comments: sigma_2(n) is the sum of the squares of the divisors of n (A001157).sigma_4(n) is the sum of the 4th powers of the divisors of n (A001159).
links: Paolo P. Lava, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
example: n=a(8)=48 of which divisor power sums for k=0,1,2,3,4 are 10,124,3410,131068, 5732210 resp. Here Sigma_2=3410 and Sigma_4=3410*1681.
maple: with(numtheory);List046871:=proc(q) local a,b,k,n;for n from 1 to q do a:=divisors(n);  b:=nops(a);  if type(add(a[k]^4,k=1..b)/add(a[k]^2,k=1..b),integer) then print(n); fi;od; end: List046871(10^6); # _Paolo P. Lava_, Apr 10 2013
prog: (MAGMA) [n: n in [1..1600] | IsZero(DivisorSigma(4,n) mod DivisorSigma(2,n))]; // _Bruno Berselli_, Apr 10 2013
author: _Labos Elemer_
